author: Jared Malsin
title: Egypt Prolongs Campaign Against Islamic State
text:
CAIRO—Egypt’s military has discarded a deadline to stamp out armed groups in the Sinai Peninsula that have killed hundreds of civilians, raising questions about the government’s ability to deal with the Islamic State-linked insurgency before a presidential election this month.
Days before the Thursday target date set by President Abdel Fattah Al Sisi to “stabilize” Sinai, Egypt’s military chief of staff said it would take more time, citing the difficulty of rooting out militants from residential areas.
